title: Say Goodbye to Squishy Supports
body: So they buffed tanks last meta, buffed ADCs this meta, but hey who cares about the supports right? If you're a squishy support like sona, or nami you're screwed because your mechanical play means virtually nothing to people who now 1 shot and don't die, which is pretty much everyone in this meta. So great job Rito, you just screwed your squishy supports.

replies.body:
In fact, squishy ranged AP support where buffed this patch.

Hard.
Where? Show me where they were buffed this patch.

You are taking Deathfire Touch on Bard when Thunderlord's Decree is better.

You are taking Grasp of the Undying on Alistar when Windspeaker's Blessing is better.

You are taking Grasp of the Undying on Sona when Windspeaker's Blessing (or even Thunderlord's Decree) are far, far better.
------------------------
You are not taking the right masteries.  Full-stop.

You also don't seem to be building a gold generation item on your supports.  As such, you fall extremely farm behind on gold no matter who you play.

Your builds are extremely questionable too.
----------------------
tl;dr There is a lot you are doing wrong.

First Deathfire touch is the best thing you can build on bard in ap dmg, unless you feel you should go down completely in the utility tree in which case you've clearly never played bard correctly. Have you ever actually played alistar or are you theorizing because you clearly have no idea what the hell you're talking about. I don't build gold generation items because to make up for them I have 5.3 gp5 in runes, it gives a much better survival ratio and a heavier lead which by the way leads to a lot less gold wasted and more generated in the long run. Kid go back to playing top or whatever you specialize in because you clearly have no understanding of how a support works.

Deathfire Touch deals reduced damage on AoE abilities (which Bard's Q and passive count as).  Meanwhile, he can proc Thunderlord's Decree with a Q and basic attack with passive for additional burst when harassing.

Alistar's heal is AoE so Windspeaker's Blessing lets him provide an armor and MR buff to his team during fights similar to Locket of the Iron Solari.  Grasp of the Undying is inefficient since you won't be in combat long enough to activate it frequently during laning phase and there are better options during teamfights.

Gold generation runes make you more squishy early-game than defensive runes and they provide less gold generation that the support items at all stages of the game provided you proc them competently.
----------------------
Yeah, I managed to hit Platinum last season by not knowing how every role works and being able to competently fill them when necessary.  

As if.
---------------------
Honestly, if your "build" were as effective as you seem to believe it is, it would be the meta build.

It is not.  

Players far better than you or I have determined that the current meta builds are the **m**ost **e**ffective **t**actics **a**vailable.
------------------
However, don't mind me.

You do you.

See how far that gets you.

*Facepalm* there's no convincing him, just leave him.

Apparently he knows better than pro players.

Eh, sometimes you have to try.  If they decide to stew in ignorance after that, then they have no one to blame but themselves.

Also, it's kinda hilarious to watch their stubborn support of their ignorance.

Yea you're right I should definitely go thunderlords, never mind that the entire utility tree does nothing for bard but please tell me more about how I should take the keystone in that tree and give up all the bonuses he gets from the other tree for a slightly lesser keystone. Alistars aoe heal doesn't heal anyone else for much anymore since they nerfed the shit out of it a few patches ago, see this is what I mean you don't play support so you don't know these very basic things, it's not the same as playing a top build kid.

Gold regeneration runes WOULD make you more squishy if I didnt start with massive health or armor which I can do BECAUSE I build runes and have no need of a gp5 item I replace the weak ass gp5 starter items with items like a ruby crystal which might not sound like it makes a difference but try it sometime and when you win the first 4 engagements because of that health you'll see what I'm talking about. Once again something you would know if you played support.

I know you're trying to help, but honestly you have no clue what you're talking about.

Supports take at least 12 points into the Cunning tree anyways for Bandit.  If you aren't, you are an idiot since it provides additional free gold generation.  At that point, Flat Hybrid Pen or CDR with Thunderlord's Decree is better than percentage magic penetration for most of the game.

You don't take Winderspeaker's Blessing on Alistar to increase the value of his heal; you take it to provide additional resistances to your entire team and mitigate damage.  As  I had previously explained if you are incapable of reading.
----------------------
Face of the Mountain provides more sustain than Ruby Crystal (for both you and the ADC) after you have proc'ed it twice and gives you an additional potion.  Ancient Coin provides more sustain after 30 minions die and Spellthief's Edge provides more gold and damage than the alternatives.

But please, tell me how 5 GP/10, Ruby Crystal (150HP) and 2 Potions makes you more durable than 12 Armor (Quints), 72 Health (Seals), Relic Shield (70HP, 40 heal per proc) and 3 Potions.

It's hilarious.
------------------
Here, have a nice resource which can show how Platinum+ players typically build: http://champion.gg/

It won't help you much if you can't understand something as obvious as the above, but it might let you know how to build until you learn the basics.
